member.name: T:OxyPlot.Axes.CategoryAxis
member.summary: Represents a category axis.
member.remarks: The category axis is using the label collection indices as the coordinate. If you have 5 categories in the Labels collection, the categories will be placed at coordinates 0 to 4. The range of the axis will be from -0.5 to 4.5 (excl. padding).

member.remarks: The formatString and values works as in string.Format. In addition, you can format properties of the item object by using the syntax {PropertyName:Formatstring}. E.g. if you have a "Value" property in your item's class, use "{Value:0.00}" to output the value with two digits. member.name: T:OxyPlot.Conrec
member.summary: Provides functionality to create contours from a triangular mesh.

remarks.para: Ported from C / Fortran code by Paul Bourke. See Conrec for full description of code and the original source.

Contouring aids in visualizing three dimensional surfaces on a two dimensional medium (on paper or in this case a computer graphics screen). Two most common applications are displaying topological features of an area on a map or the air pressure on a weather map. In all cases some parameter is plotted as a function of two variables, the longitude and latitude or x and y axis. One problem with computer contouring is the process is usually CPU intensive and the algorithms often use advanced mathematical techniques making them susceptible to error.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Conrec.Contour(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],OxyPlot.Conrec.RendererDelegate)
member.summary: Contour is a contouring subroutine for rectangularily spaced data It emits calls to a line drawing subroutine supplied by the user which draws a contour map corresponding to data on a randomly spaced rectangular grid. The coordinates emitted are in the same units given in the x() and y() arrays. Any number of contour levels may be specified but they must be in order of increasing value.

member.name: T:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis
member.summary: Represents an axis with logarithmic scale.
member.remarks: See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logarithmic_scale.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.#ctor(OxyPlot.Axes.AxisPosition,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.#ctor(OxyPlot.Axes.AxisPosition,System.Double,System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.CoerceActualMaxMin
member.summary: Coerces the actual maximum and minimum values.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.GetTickValues(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Double}@,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Double}@,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.Double}@)
member.summary: Gets the coordinates used to draw ticks and tick labels (numbers or category names).

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.IsValidValue(System.Double)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified value is valid.
member.returns: true if the specified value is valid; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.IsXyAxis
member.summary: Determines whether the axis is used for X/Y values.
member.returns: true if it is an XY axis; otherwise, false .

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.Pan(OxyPlot.ScreenPoint,OxyPlot.ScreenPoint)
member.summary: Pans the specified axis.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.Transform(System.Double)
member.summary: Transforms the specified coordinate to screen coordinates.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.ZoomAt(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Zooms the axis at the specified coordinate.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.PostInverseTransform(System.Double)
member.summary: Applies a transformation after the inverse transform of the value. This is used in logarithmic axis.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.PreTransform(System.Double)
member.summary: Applies a transformation before the transform the value. This is used in logarithmic axis.

member.name: M:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.UpdateActualMaxMin
member.summary: Updates the actual maximum and minimum values. If the user has zoomed/panned the axis, the internal ViewMaximum/ViewMinimum values will be used. If Maximum or Minimum have been set, these values will be used. Otherwise the maximum and minimum values of the series will be used, including the 'padding'.

member.name: P:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.Base
member.summary: Gets or sets the logarithmic base (normally 10).
member.remarks: See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Logarithm.

member.name: P:OxyPlot.Axes.LogarithmicAxis.PowerPadding
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the ActualMaximum and ActualMinimum values should be padded to the nearest power of the Base.

member.name: T:OxyPlot.MarkerType

member.summary: Do not render markers.

member.summary: Render markers as circles.

member.summary: Render markers as squares.

member.name: F:OxyPlot.MarkerType.Diamond
member.summary: Render markers as diamonds.

member.name: F:OxyPlot.MarkerType.Triangle
member.summary: Render markers as triangles.

member.name: F:OxyPlot.MarkerType.Cross
member.summary: Render markers as crosses (note: this marker type requires the stroke color to be set).
member.remarks: This marker type requires the stroke color to be set.

member.name: F:OxyPlot.MarkerType.Plus
member.summary: Renders markers as plus signs (note: this marker type requires the stroke color to be set).
member.remarks: This marker type requires the stroke color to be set.

member.name: F:OxyPlot.MarkerType.Star
member.summary: Renders markers as stars (note: this marker type requires the stroke color to be set).
member.remarks: This marker type requires the stroke color to be set.

member.name: F:OxyPlot.MarkerType.Custom
member.summary: Render markers by a custom shape (defined by outline).
